Case reference: 2014001795.CaseDesc: John Boone has been missing since December 24, 1998, from Saint John, New Brunswick. John suffers from depression and reportedly was not taking his medication. John's family is from the St. Andrews, New Brunswick area.

Case reference: 2021059091.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1988, Rocco Recchia was last seen carrying an overnight bag as he walked towards the train station on Lower Mill Street in Poughkeepsie, New York, USA. At the time of his disappearance, Rocco was despondent.

Scar: Right Hand, On fingers of the right hand
Left Upper Arm, Left upper arm

Case reference: 2022052659.CaseDesc: On October 16, 2022, Bradley Kiefer was seen for the last time by his family in Medicine Hat, Alberta. At the time of his disappearance, all of Bradley’s personal belongings, and vehicle were left at his residence.

Case reference: 2014003746.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1972, Mario Cardinal was reported missing by his family. At the time of his disappearance, he lived in Trois-Rivières, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005083.CaseDesc: Alexander Belcourt was reported missing by his family in November 1995. He has not been seen or heard from since September 1991. During the time of his disappearance, Alexander was known to live in the inner core of Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004104.CaseDesc: In August of 1977, Jonas Haineault, was visiting family in Lymburn, Alberta. Jonas departed by bus from nearby Hythe, Alberta for Edmonton, Alberta. This is the last his family had heard from him and it is unknown whether Jonas arrived in Edmonton.

Case reference: 2006019199.CaseDesc: Marion Thiessen was reported missing by her husband in November, 1979. She has gone missing several times in the past and it has been discovered that she lived in Vancouver, British Columbia about 28 years ago.  She contacted an acquaintance in 1984, but there has been no contact with Marion Thiessen since that time.

Teeth: False, Partial dentures on both lower and upper teeth.

Case reference: 2014005683.CaseDesc: Lorie MacDougall was last seen on October 11, 2011, leaving her residence in St.Catherines, Ontario.  Shortly after this, Lorie’s vehicle was located abandoned in a parking lot near Niagara Glen Centre in Niagara Falls, Ontario.  At this time Lorie was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 2019010720.CaseDesc: Patrick Comeau was last seen on November 13, 2017, in Montreal, Quebec. Patrick has been known to frequent the downtown Montreal area.

Case reference: 2017004181.CaseDesc: On January 16, 2017, Glen Swanton was seen for the last time in the area of Minden Hills, Ontario.  Mr. Swanton’s abandoned vehicle was later located in the area of Kinmount, Ontario, on January 18, 2017.

Foreign Object: Left Wrist, Metal plate in his wrist

Case reference: 2013000111.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1954, Clifford Edward Sherwood Thorne was seen for the last time at the family residence in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. Clifford left home to go to school and was never seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2018040713.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1996, at approximately 7:30am, William Chan was last seen when he dropped off his son at school in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Ski coat; Brand-North Face

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2005003499.CaseDesc: On July 22, 2002, a Caucasian male, was found in the Niagara River, near the Queenston Dock in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 187 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix is present. He may have been a smoker. He was likely in the water for a few days at most.

Hair: Brown, Shorter than collar length, receding hair line
Teeth: He has natural teeth with some amalgam and composite resin restorations

Case reference: 1999108210.CaseDesc: René Bessette was abducted when he was 8 years old by his father, Roger Bessette, leaving behind his mother and siblings.  His father's car was found abandoned later on the Victoria Bridge in Montreal.  The photos of René have been age-progressed to 40 years old.

Case reference: 2014003816.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1992, Stéphane Murray left his residence in the Beauport area to attend an appointment. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Death's head and a bat

Case reference: 2014005450.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1979 James Gordon Nevin departed from his residence in Amherstburg, Ontario heading west for a 2 week vacation with the intention of visiting relatives. Mr. Nevin had a grandson in Winnipeg, Manitoba and a son in Prince George, British Columbia. Neither relative had prior notification Mr. Nevin's intentions to visit.   On June 14, 1979 the RCMP responded to a call and James Nevin's vehicle, a 1974 white/maroon Dodge Coronet, was located in a ditch between Rocanville, Saskatchewan and St. Lazare, Manitoba. Inquiries reveal the vehicle was at this location since June 8, 1979.   Mr. Nevin has never been seen again and likely went missing between 1:30 pm and 3:00 pm on June 8, 1979. Extensive searches were conducted by land and air all with negative results. James Gordon Nevin was never seen again. Foul play cannot be ruled out.

Scar: Right Thumb, Skin graft scar on right or left thumb

Case reference: 2015054215.CaseDesc: On October 03, 1996, James Bruce Hill-Tout, failed to show up for a family dinner in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2016052152.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2016 at approximately 9:30 p.m., John Casey was seen for the last time aboard a cruise vessel in transit between Cap-aux-Meules and Havre Saint-Pierre, Quebec. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017004343.CaseDesc: Mr. Landry Ntwari travelled to Niagara Falls on January 9, 2017, for a birthday celebration. He was a registered hotel guest staying at a downtown hotel. Since January 10th, there has been no further contact or no known sighting.

Case reference: 2006011099.CaseDesc: Kenneth Richard Wolfe was working on Caribou Lake, (15 km north west of Armstrong, Ontario). On October 8, 1970, he left alone in a 16 foot steel boat to work on a dock. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. Wolfe.

Case reference: 2014004359.CaseDesc: On July 20, 2003, Stephane Gallant was last seen at the Shoreline Hotel in Thunder Bay, Ontario.  Stephane speaks French and English with a French accent.  Stephane worked in the logging industry as a woodcutter. On July 23, 2003, his vehicle, a 1984 GMC S10 blue pickup with a black topper, was located at the Trowbridge Falls campsite on Copenhagen Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004779.CaseDesc: On May 3, 2006, Mr. David Robillard left a cultural camp with the intention to walk back to his home community of Black Lake, SK. He was not seen again.

Deformity: Right Leg, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2012020136.CaseDesc: Guy Verdon has been missing since March 24, 2010. On that day, he went to his daughter’s residence in Charlemagne, Quebec. He left her residence around 7:00 pm and was never seen again. Guy's associate, François Robillard also disappeared around the same time.

Teeth: False, Had partials, top and bottom
Chain: Gold, Gold, Pendant, medallion of the Holy Virgin
Watch: Gold, Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Raymond Weil brand, two-tone bracelet
Amputation: Left Middle Finger, Tip of middle finger amputated

Case reference: 2014001739.CaseDesc: In March 1994, Joseph Bucar, having been laid off from Cassiar Mines years prior, had placed his furniture and effects in storage, accumulated credit card debt and disappeared from Kelowna BC.

Case reference: 2019015016.CaseDesc: On March 14, 2019, at approximately 5:30 am, Monica Duah was seen for the last time by her friends at her work place in Toronto, Ontario. She failed to show up to work for her scheduled shifts.

Case reference: 2006026599.CaseDesc: On August 1, 1995, William Reed left his residence and left a note saying he was going fishing. His truck was located parked near Gibson Mill Road, Phelps Township, with the keys and his wallet inside.

Hat: Green, cap with white lettering on the front

Case reference: 2014003364.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1992, Heather Miller was reported missing by her boyfriend. Ms. Miller was believed to live a transient lifestyle, and could have traveled between Vancouver, BC, Merritt, BC, California, USA, and possibly as far as Australia.

Case reference: 2014006541.CaseDesc: Roxanne Fleming has not been seen since approximately 1986.  Around the time of last contact, she spent time in Lillooet, BC, Kamloops, BC, Vancouver, BC, Red Deer, AB, and Edmonton, AB.  The circumstances of her disappearance are unknown.

Case reference: 2014006426.CaseDesc: Sara Coates was last seen in the Stanley Park area in Calgary, Alberta. Ms. Coates was leading a nomadic lifestyle, living out of her van with her dog and 3 cats, travelling around Alberta and BC. Ms. Coates’ van was located October 22, 2013, in a secluded area of Morley, Alberta. It appeared to have been there for some time. Police investigations regarding Ms. Coates’ whereabouts are ongoing.

Scar: 2 small surgical scars on inner groin

Case reference: 2014002295.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1979, James Caraley was last seen when he went mountain climbing on Mount Andromeda in Jasper, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003748.CaseDesc: On September 29th, 1996, police were contacted by a friend to report his 3 hunting partners, including Glen Mymryk who were overdue from a hunting trip. He also advised he found one of the barrels from the boat they took, floating towards shore and he could see something on the lake through the binoculars but was unsure what it was. The three men left in a loaded boat and got halfway to their destination when they decided the water conditions were too bad and they turned around. The men were bailing but the waves were too much, the motor stalled and they capsized. Mr. Mymryk was last seen floating away soon after the boat capsized. The lone survivor was rescued 7 hours after the incident and indicate the other 2 men he was with had drowned.

Case reference: 2014004301.CaseDesc: Zolton Zambory was reported missing by his estranged wife on January 24, 1965. On January 30, 1965, Vancouver City Police located his vehicle abandoned in Vancouver. His vehicle was unlocked with his personal belongings left behind. He emigrated from Germany and arrived in Quebec on May, 1957.

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2015066565.CaseDesc: George Wood was last seen in Surrey BC, on June 20, 2015 by family. At the time George Wood was reported missing, he was unemployed and of no fixed address living on the streets in Burnaby BC. His absence and not keeping in touch with family is out of character.

Belt: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black belt with large silver buckle
Scar: Right Arm, Long scar on right arm

Case reference: 2014005192.CaseDesc: In the late afternoon of May 12, 1980, Adjutor Lapointe was seen for the last time leaving his residence in his vehicle in Chicoutimi, Quebec. During this time, he was accompanied by an acquaintance.

Case reference: 2014003215.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1972, a group of seven people, including Hank Ethier, were fishing on the Burntwood River. Late in the day the group and their two boats went to shore for supper. One group, which included Hank, left the shore. They were however unable to get their boat started and as a result they began to drift backwards towards the rapids. This group called for help and the other boat went to their aid. Hank jumped from his boat and swam to the second one. Once they reached the disabled boat everyone was told to get in. Both boats encountered the rapids. It is assumed Hank drowned as a result of the mishap.

Case reference: 2014001998.CaseDesc: On July 27, 1985, Maxime Morais accompanied Pierre Beaulieu as they left the City of Montreal, Quebec in Pierre's vehicle, a 1980 orange convertible MG, and traveled to the municipality of Rawdon. They never came back home.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2015018154.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1966, Delores Whiteman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004551.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1984, Robert Plewes was last seen at his residence in Toronto, Ontario. His truck was found six days later near Algonquin Park located in Ontario.

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Indigenous descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014004877.CaseDesc: On February 9, 2006, Michelle Mercer was seen for the last time walking away from an argument with her boyfriend, in the area of 105 Street and 69 Avenue in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005268.CaseDesc: On 26 May 2009, Harold Dorion was reported missing to the Nelson House RCMP (Nisichawayasihk Cree Nation) in Manitoba. Investigations later established that he was last seen in the last week of July 2007. There have been no sightings or contact with Harold since that time. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014006177.CaseDesc: On October 9, 1987, at approximately 9:00 p.m. Phillip Orvis went out onto the lake in his boat from Matheson Island. He was planning to go to his fishing camp at Black Bear Island. At the time that he left the water on the lake was very rough. Phillip could not swim and he was known to never wear a life jacket. His boat was found the next day drifted up against the mainland approximately 1/2 mile south east of the dock where he is believed to have left from. The boat was filled with water. Searches were conducted by land, air and water and dragging operations were conducted on the lake however his body was never located. Phillip Orvis is presumed dead due to drowning and foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014004563.CaseDesc: Brian Nadeau and David Pushor were last seen on November 25, 2004 travelling together in a 1983 Honda Civic near Fort Assiniboine, Alberta. The vehicle was later recovered from the Athabasca river where Highway 661 crosses via an ice bridge in the winter. Mr. Nadeau and Mr. Pushor were not located.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Text "Love is kind, 69er, Devil"

Case reference: 2013000010.CaseDesc: Jaime Wyatt was reported missing to the St-John's RCMP by family members that he had not been seen since November 12th, 1996. Jaime was a resident of Newfoundland and left the province in September 1996 to seek employment in Nova Scotia. The investigation revealed that Jaime stayed at the Twin Elms Motel on Inglis Street in Halifax, Nova Scotia and he was last seen there on November 16th, 1996. On the evening of November 16th, 1996, Jaime informed the staff at Twin Elms that he was going to be picked up to go to a dinner party that evening.  Jaime was never heard from or seen since that day and foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014004474.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1987, Lillian Kotyk was last seen when she left her home in Edmonton, Alberta. Lillian has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020016353.CaseDesc: In April 2020, Travis Hollar last contacted his family. During the time of his disappearance, Travis was residing in Edmonton, Alberta, and was living a transient lifestyle. In the past, he suffered from a brain injury which caused diminished cognitive abilities.

Case reference: 2014006229.CaseDesc: In 1981, Cyril Thistle was seen for the last time when he was out on day parole and visiting his sister.  There is reason to believe that Mr. Thistle lived a transient lifestyle as he was known in Toronto, Ontario and on the west coast of Canada.

Case reference: 2006017299.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1998, Jake Just attended a party at a residence in the north end of the town of Midland. He was last seen walking home from the party, then separating from his friends to take a short cut through a wooded area. An extensive search of the area turned up negative.

Backpack: Nylon, Black, Gold, jaguar logo and gold stitching
Shoes: Canvas, Black, Blue, "DVS" - skateboarder style - size 11
Scar: Left Upper Arm, 4" raised scar inside bicep

Case reference: 2014003404.CaseDesc: Armand Comtois was reported missing on May 2, 1985. At the time of his disappearance he was living in Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec. He was seen by a family member on March 9, 1985 but he has not been seen or heard from since this date. He also used the name of "Simon".

Teeth: Dental appliance, partial composed of 4 upper teeth.

Case reference: 2014001441.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1972, James Cordell was seen for the last time leaving his parents’ residence in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, James was driving a 1970 silver blue Dodge Polar vehicle.  He had a cast on his right arm and his teeth were wired shut as a result of a motor vehicle collision.

Shirt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, White, SHRT SLEEV, Mauve and white terrycloth short sleeve

Case reference: 2016068711.CaseDesc: On September 30, 1969, an unidentified male was found 0.8 kilometres west of Sioux Lookout. His death appears to be self-inflicted

Case reference: 2014004992.CaseDesc: On October 12, 2004, at approximately 11:30 a.m., Kim Evans was seen for the last time at the North York Women’s Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Kim had said she was going to her family’s residence to collect her personal belongings.

Pierce: Nose, Nose ring on the right side

Case reference: 2019073733.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2019, Trevor Batoche was seen for the last time in Penticton, British Columbia. Trevor was known to frequently travel to Northern British Columbia and Edmonton, Alberta, possibly driving an older black pickup truck.

Case reference: 2020007336.CaseDesc: On December 16, 1970, Abraham Wolfson was seen for the last time leaving a law office in Toronto, Ontario. Abraham had left with certificates worth $50,000 and had come into the city to arrange the sale of a property. Despite the offer of a reward from Abraham’s family, there has been no information pertaining to his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2009000199.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1996, Alf Joergensen left his residence to go on a business trip to London, England. Mr. Joergensen told his wife he would be returning on either October 22nd or 23rd. He indicated he was meeting a business associate in London, however it was later confirmed there were no scheduled  business meetings with this particular individual, who hadn't seen Mr. Joergensen since the previous year. Mr. Joergensen flew to England on October 17, 1996 and was confirmed to have flown into Toronto airport on October 19, 1996, via British Airways. He has not been seen nor heard from since this date and his family and police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Rear teeth both sides of upper jaw missing.  Dental records available.

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2014002041.CaseDesc: Sometime over the night of November 19 to 20, 1999, Mathieu Parent was seen for the last time leaving the Dagobert night club in Quebec, Quebec. His family has not heard from him since.

Pants: Nylon, Dark Blue, With white lines on the sides
Shoes: Blue, Yellow, With fluorescent yellow lines
Sweater: Cotton, Light Blue, Fubu, Long sleeves

Case reference: 2014004933.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1987, at approximately 7:00pm, Jimmy Hong was last seen by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. His friend indicated that Jimmy had left for Hamilton, Ontario, and would be returning the following Monday.

Case reference: 2014004714.CaseDesc: In May 1975, William Lindsay was seen for the last time in Field, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, William, also known as Larry, had cashed in a federal tax refund cheque at a corner store. Prior to his disappearance in 1972, he had completed the Air Force’s basic training course (#7214) in Cornwallis, Nova Scotia, and then enrolled in the Communication Systems Tech course.

Scar: Cheek, Small crescent shaped on the left side

Case reference: 2013000128.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1990, Delphine Nikal was left in the care of her uncle. At approximately 2:00 pm Delphine advised her uncle she was going to meet her three girlfriends in Smithers BC (approx 16 km. away).  Delphine hitchhiked to Smithers and met up with her friends. At approximately 10:00 pm Delphine called her uncle to tell him that she was on her way home from Smithers. She was last seen by her two friends hitchhiking in the east bound lane of Hwy #16.

Jacket: Denim, Blue, Light bleached with white pocket sewn on inside, Levi's
Pants: Denim, Pink, Described as a hot pink and tight to the leg. Knee length
Purse: Leather, Black, Pouch style containing hair spray, brush, pictures, make up, address book

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2014005826.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2012, the Banff RCMP were contacted by a tour company to report that Duc Dao and his son, Nguyen Dao of Vietnam did not arrive to board their bus at the scheduled time.  The two men had been staying at the Banff International Hotel and there were no personal items left in their room. The two men were due to fly back to Vietnam two days later. However, they did not board their scheduled flight and it is unknown if they returned to Vietnam.

Case reference: 2014002743.CaseDesc: On January 16, 1994, Yoann Crouzatier was reported missing after leaving the family residence in Laval, Quebec. Yoann has not been seen or heard from since.

Boots: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Metal tips
Coat: Beige, Three-quarters with fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2020040979.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2020, François Danford-Dussault was seen for the last time by his family in Gatineau, Quebec. François is known to be a solitary man who speaks French and English and travels by foot or bicycle. It is believed he may have travelled to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2020051730.CaseDesc: On Dec 10, 2020, Gurpreet Singh Parmar was last seen on a video surveillance camera walking away from his family residence in Abbotsford, British Columbia.  Gurpreet has not been seen or heard from since.

Backpack: Other, Lunch bag or Lunch pail with shoulder strap
Hat: Other, Possibly wearing a brimmed hat
Pants: Other, Possibly wearing dark pants or sweatpants
Sweater: Other, Dark coloured sweater, hoodie or jacket, possibly red

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2017020043.CaseDesc: Louis Judah Gonick was seen being picked up by taxi cab at his University dormitory residence at 7:09 PM, April 16, 2017, and was last seen at 7:32 PM, being dropped off at the Stanley Park causeway.

Case reference: 2010003999.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday May 28, 1999, Tammy Lamondin, age 20,  was with friends on Main Street in Newmarket. She remained in their company until sometime after midnight. In the early morning hours of May 29, 1999, Tammy left the Newmarket area with a male acquaintance. She was not seen again. The police conducted an investigation but were not able to locate her.

Tattoo: Right Ankle, Dolphin above right ankle

Case reference: 2012020126.CaseDesc: Rollande Doherty, 52 years old, disappeared on February 2nd 2007. She was last seen around 2:30pm near the library in Rouyn-Noranda.

Case reference: 2022057068.CaseDesc: Michael Wry was visiting family in Ontario in 2021 from British Columbia.  Due to Covid travel restrictions he couldn’t leave.  In August of 2022, Michael was supposed to be taking a train back to BC.

Case reference: 2012020108.CaseDesc: On March 26, 2006, Tommy Clément-Pépin was seen for the last time at approximately 11:00 a.m., in a hotel in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec. His vehicle was located in a parking lot in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014041193.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2014, Colten Pratt was seen for the last time in the downtown area of Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2019056482.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 26, 2019, Gregory Paul Agnew was seen for the last time in his green Pontiac Sunfire, leaving a mushroom picker’s camp located at the 11km mark on the Kinsckutch Forest Service Road in New Aiyansh, to run errands in Terrace, British Columbia. On the evening of September 27, 2019, the Pontiac Sunfire was observed at his campsite along with his camper van, but Gregory was not there. An extensive search of the area was conducted with no success. Gregory has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006211.CaseDesc: On June 29, 1978, Nick Ostashek was seen for the last time in Andrew, Alberta. Nick had recently been released from the Two Hills hospital and was despondent. His vehicle was located near the Shandro Bridge in Two Hills County, Alberta.

Case reference: 2020011412.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1985, Tahiya Shiekh was last seen in Scarborough, Ontario.  The family doesn't know why she left home. It is believed she left in the middle of the night while her mother and siblings were sleeping. The next morning, she was to take her younger siblings to the zoo.  It was then that the family realized she wasn't at home.

Case reference: 2013000132.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2008 Trevor Warkentin left the Pyschiatric Ward at the MSA Hospital in Abbotsford BC. A hospital staff worker believes seeing Trevor get into a red pick up truck, but no license plate was obtained.

Teeth: Good, Large gap between front teeth

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2014005961.CaseDesc: Chris Metallic was last seen in Sackville, New Brunswick, at around 3 a.m. on Sunday, November 25, 2012. He had been attending a party at a residence in Sackville on Saturday night. After receiving information that a person was observed at approximately 5:30 a.m. on Sunday walking on Upper Aboujagane Road, authorities focused their search in a wooded area and river off Route 940 heading toward Shemogue.

Deformity: Unknown, Crooked fingers on left hand

Case reference: 2020021899.CaseDesc: Nowell HALFE was last seen by family in Edmonton, Alberta in 2013. The last documented occurrence for HALFE puts him in Edmonton, Alberta in January of 2014.

Case reference: 2014001538.CaseDesc: During the month of March, 1998, Theresa Johnny was seen for the last time in Whitehorse, Yukon. The last known contact with Theresa was on July 18, 1998, with the Anchorage Police Department in Alaska, United States. Over the years, there have been a number of unconfirmed tips received about Theresa’s location and well being.

Case reference: 2013000028.CaseDesc: Leonette Purcell has not been seen or heard from since she disappeared on December 16, 2004, from her Grand Lake home situated near the Halifax International Airport. The circumstances of Mrs. Purcell's disappearance are suspicious and foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2018005122.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2018, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Balwant Singh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Balwant was visiting Canada and failed to board his returning flight on January 29 at 6:00 p.m.

Case reference: 2013000108.CaseDesc: Roger Houle is missing from Montreal since July 12, 1996. Roger is hearing impaired and mute. He left his home without taking anything. He worked for 15 years at the same place and he never advised his employer that he would not be returning to work.

Case reference: 2014004860.CaseDesc: Lesley Holmes was reported missing by her common law husband on December 23, 2005 after not having contact with her since November 23, 2005.  They had been living in a basement apartment in Toronto, the home of a friend. Lesley did not feel comfortable staying there without her common law who was away, so she moved out. She was believed to have spent some time in a shelter but this could not be confirmed by the shelter.  Her family has not seen or heard from her since that time.

Case reference: 2015019929.CaseDesc: On April 16, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Sribavan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000048.CaseDesc: On May 26, 2002, Mendes Joseph was seen for the last time at his apartment located in the Montréal-Nord district of Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005033.CaseDesc: On April 28, 2000, at approximately 9:45 a.m., Kim Mezo was seen for the last time as she left the Branson Hospital in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010003499.CaseDesc:
On March 21, 2010 Chung Law left work on Dundas St, London ON. He told his employer that he was experiencing some stress and would be taking a couple of days off. Mr. Law spoke to his wife, who lives in Vaughan, ON, and told her he was coming home for a visit. He spoke to his employer the next day, saying he was in Toronto and that he did not want to return to work in London. Mr. Law never did arrive home. Investigation has revealed that Mr. Law may have travelled to Toronto by bus. 

In April, 2011 a right foot contained within a black boot was located in the river flats of the Thames River in Elgin County. The area was searched and no further remains were found. DNA confirmed that the foot was that of Mr. Law.

Scar: Left Thigh, Surgery scar on upper left thigh

Case reference: 2014006225.CaseDesc: On August 28, 2001, Erum KAMAL was seen for the last time near the High Level bridge in Edmonton, Alberta.  Erum was wearing a white t-shirt, blue pants and was described as a Southeast Asian from Pakistan.

Case reference: 2014002023.CaseDesc: Lara Brown was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in September 1998.  Lara was last heard from by a friend at the end of August 1998.

Case reference: 2014004844.CaseDesc: On September 30, 2006, Aaron Derbyshire, was seen for the last time in the early morning hours in downtown Kelowna, British Columbia.  Aaron, a long term resident of Kelowna, had spent the evening out with friends after a day's work as a local surveyor.

Case reference: 2006021599.CaseDesc: Zbigniew Gajda left Thunder Bay on his snowmobile to go ice fishing on Lake Superior.  He was last seen on January 4, 2001 around Caribou Island Point.  It is thought that his snowmobile may have gone through the ice.

Jacket: Black, Purple and blue on arms
